intro: Scleria scaberrima, commonly known as the rough-surfaced sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and clustered flowering spikes. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often arranged in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. Scleria scaberrima is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in diverse aquatic and semi-aquatic habitats.
